Text: Blessed are all who fear the LORD, who walk in His ways!
Context: The tone is one of contentment and happiness, addressed to those who show reverence towards God.

Text: You will eat the fruit of your labor; blessings and prosperity will be yours.
Context: This verse continues with the theme of blessings, linking reverence for God with the reward of personal labor.

Text: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house; your sons will be like olive shoots around your table.
Context: The imagery here speaks to a sense of flourishing family life as a reward for fearing the Lord.

Text: Thus is the man blessed who fears the LORD.
Context: Reiterating the message that reverence for the LORD brings blessings.

Text: May the LORD bless you from Zion, so that you may see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life,
Context: This verse contains a prayer for ongoing blessings, with a focus on seeing the prosperity of the spiritual center Jerusalem.

Text: May you see your children's children. Peace be upon Israel.
Context: The psalm ends with a wish for extended family blessings and peace upon the nation.
